dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis lbw b Imran Tahir 62 (94b 10x4 0x6 120m) SR: 65.95

dismissalComment.html: Mendis has been given out lbw by umpire Kettleborough, he challenges the on-field decision. Lovely legbreak from Tahir, starts around middle, opens 'em him, grips and spins away to strike the knee-roll of the back pad, fizzing past the outside edge, in front of off stump. Pitching in line, impact in line, and hitting off stump. Three reds and Mendis has to exit for 62

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva c du Plessis b Parnell 28 (53b 1x4 0x6 77m) SR: 52.83

dismissalComment.html: and Dhananjaya also perishes. Could this spell the end for Sri Lanka? A 200 score now seems a distant possibility. The ball is pitched right up there and Dhananjaya tries to go big down the ground. Du Plessis is inside the circle at mid-off and he runs to his right to snaffle it as the ball is skied. Looking to hit with the wind but does not get the distance

dismissalText.commentary: Asela Gunaratne run out (†de Kock/Parnell/Morris) 10 (9b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: A mix-up between the wickets - the last thing SL needed - they sent it upstairs. Asela is caught short at the non-striker's end. Not out flashes on the big screen? What? TV umpire Illingworth quickly cleans up the mess and out flashes now. The middle-order slump shows no signs of abating. De Silva had driven the ball to the left of the off-side sweeper, Morris hunted the ball down, a bit of yes-no between Asela and de Silva. Morris capitalises on it, throws the ball to the keeper who relays it to Parnell. Gone...

dismissalComment.html: that's more like it. Fires it full and it comes on straight outside off. Tempts the batsman to go after it outside off and Kulasekara does so, that too, without feet. Sticks his bat out a long way across and gets a healthy outside edge that flies to the right of de Kock who snaffles a brilliant low catch as he he gets down to his right

dismissalText.commentary: Jeffrey Vandersay lbw b Morris 8 (16b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: fuller ball, Vandersay was walking right across, playing for the angle, but it comes a tad straighter than he expects it to and he misses contact on the flick. Gets rapped on the pads, looks close and the umpire Jele raises his finger. Could the inward angle perhaps have taken it down leg? Sri Lanka do not have any reviews left. But it looks close, would have perhaps clipped leg and the umpire's call would have remained

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c & b Gunaratne 57 (71b 5x4 1x6 110m) SR: 80.28

dismissalComment.html: what a soft dismissal! The lack of pace does him in. This one in fact turns back in like an off-break. Besides, the lack of pace means that he plays early and does not time it well at all. Pops the simplest of return catches and the bowler takes it in front of him. Amla's fluent innings comes to an end but South Africa are coasting here

commentTextItems.html: tossed up legbreak outside off, sliced away fine of short third man

commentPostTextItems.html: Right then. That brings an end to our coverage for this game. We have hd an early finish today. What will the remaining games have in store? If Sri Lanka's performances in the T20 series were anything to go by, they very much have the capability of pushing this South Africa side and beating them. Can they find a way to turn it around in the coming games? Join us next time then. Thank you for your time, and goodbye!

Imran Tahir: Very happy with the way it came out. Very good, pleasing day for me and the team. Just a believer that I need to keep doing it every game, and for that, I have been working really hard. I don't take any game lightly. Playing for South Africa is really special. Today is very special because it is my wedding anniversary. My wife asked me to get five wickets and this is absolutely for her. I think I was bowling against the wind which was obviously easier for the batsmen to hit me. But i always look to bowl according to the field. Somehow I get my wickets but I try not to give runs and try and use my variations. It was a great team effort, the fast bowlers started very well and I had a chance to do the job for South Africa, which is an honour for South Africa. Every wicket I take for South Africa, I try to express how much it means to me when I celebrate. I play for a great country and a great team and I want to continue doing it for as long as I can.
Imran Tahir is the Man of the Match.

AB de Villiers I thought it was a really good performance. It was a difficult wicket to get used to, low, slow and a bit two-paced. But we used our chances really well, great bowling performance to set it up for our batters. Our new-ball bowlers bowled with a lot of intensity and Immy (Imran Tahir) bowled really well. I have had a few windy games before in my life, so I just relied on my experience from those games and it paid off really well today. There is more than enough time, Russell and I keep talking about plans and there is also Faf to bounce ideas off. It's a tricky total always. It was definitely below-par, I thought 250-260 would have been easy to chase down, but it could still have been tricky. But Quinton and Faf got off to a good start and it set things up nicely for the remaining batters. Easy win today, but we expect them to fight back in the series.

Upul Tharanga: I think Chandimal and Mendis had a partnership, but we could never pick up from the two wickets at the start. It's about spinners, the wicket was slow. Our spinners did not control the ball much, lots of areas to improve on the batting and bowling fronts. We have a couple of days to sit together as a team and have a chat about what we can improve. Like I said, both batting and bowling, lots of areas to improve.
4.45 pm All set for the presentations then.

4.38pm Sri Lanka have been utterly demolished here. They were never in the game, right from the time Wayne Parnell set the tone with his twin early strikes. Imran Tahir hastened the slide with three strikes in 15 balls, and from there, South Africa never looked back. A total of 181 was never going to be enough and there were no surprises during the chase. Sri Lanka's spinners did occasionally find a way past the edges of South Africa's batsmen but South Africa had the luxury of taking their own time given the small target. Early wickets were going to be the only way for Sri Lanka to try and make a game of this, but once Quinton de Kock and Hashim Amla got off to a steady start, it steadily shut the doors on a Sri Lankan fightback. Hashim Amla was calm and languid as ever, all silken tough and grace as he stroked his way to a fluent half-century. Faf du Plessis may not have been as pretty, but played an equally effective innings. And AB de Villiers got in some good match batting practice on his ODI return. Stay tuned. We will bring the presentations to you shortly.

A: "@Vishaal SA may have played a depleted side but Sri Lanka's 'full strength' team is a side full of newcomers each with a handful of games under their belt. I would say there wasn't much difference between the sides, SL did well to win the series and yes, they should have won all three games with their very raw side."

commentTextItems.html: nudged off the pads towards long leg for a couple. Faf reaches his fifty
slower through the air, tries to get down and do a reverse slap but does not put bat to ball

commentTextItems.html: flat and quicker, shorter in length and width on offer outside off as well, backs away and cuts but cannot find the gap
straying down the leg side, du Plessis nudges it fine and the ball seems to be heading down to the deep fine leg boundary, but deep backward square leg runs across and cuts it off in the nick of time
stays back to this length ball and flicks it away to midwicket. Brings the bat down late and so the bowler is excited and just goes up for just a moment
this time it's not as full and on the pads, so he just tucks off them behind square on the leg side

commentPreTextItems.html: Vishaal: "@PraveenP - it doesn't hold weight to state that you could have whitewashed a side when you are at almost full strength and they were playing a side that had less than half their regular players. That's the point being made here."

commentTextItems.html: flat and pushed through on leg stump, tries to clip it away to the leg side but cannot make good connection
short of a length ball, comes on flat and turns in and de Villiers uses the angle to tuck it to the leg side for a single and to retain strike

commentTextItems.html: waits for it at the crease and turns it away to midwicket for an easy single
gets down early to scoop it and the ball goes on the bounce to the fielder at short fine leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Nelisa: "AB is such a pleasure to watch. He's crickets Lionel Messi"

commentTextItems.html: flatter fullish length ball, tries to defend and gets an inside-edge to the pads
this one comes on straight outside off, no turn and du Plessis presses forward and skews it off the inside part of the blade
short of a length and spins back in, du Plessis keeps it out

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis lbw b Imran Tahir 62 (94b 10x4 0x6 120m) SR: 65.95

dismissalComment.html: Mendis has been given out lbw by umpire Kettleborough, he challenges the on-field decision. Lovely legbreak from Tahir, starts around middle, opens 'em him, grips and spins away to strike the knee-roll of the back pad, fizzing past the outside edge, in front of off stump. Pitching in line, impact in line, and hitting off stump. Three reds and Mendis has to exit for 62

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva c du Plessis b Parnell 28 (53b 1x4 0x6 77m) SR: 52.83

dismissalComment.html: and Dhananjaya also perishes. Could this spell the end for Sri Lanka? A 200 score now seems a distant possibility. The ball is pitched right up there and Dhananjaya tries to go big down the ground. Du Plessis is inside the circle at mid-off and he runs to his right to snaffle it as the ball is skied. Looking to hit with the wind but does not get the distance

dismissalText.commentary: Asela Gunaratne run out (†de Kock/Parnell/Morris) 10 (9b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: A mix-up between the wickets - the last thing SL needed - they sent it upstairs. Asela is caught short at the non-striker's end. Not out flashes on the big screen? What? TV umpire Illingworth quickly cleans up the mess and out flashes now. The middle-order slump shows no signs of abating. De Silva had driven the ball to the left of the off-side sweeper, Morris hunted the ball down, a bit of yes-no between Asela and de Silva. Morris capitalises on it, throws the ball to the keeper who relays it to Parnell. Gone...

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c †de Kock b Rabada 17 (16b 2x4 1x6 24m) SR: 106.25

dismissalComment.html: that's more like it. Fires it full and it comes on straight outside off. Tempts the batsman to go after it outside off and Kulasekara does so, that too, without feet. Sticks his bat out a long way across and gets a healthy outside edge that flies to the right of de Kock who snaffles a brilliant low catch as he he gets down to his right

dismissalText.commentary: Jeffrey Vandersay lbw b Morris 8 (16b 1x4 0x6 15m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: fuller ball, Vandersay was walking right across, playing for the angle, but it comes a tad straighter than he expects it to and he misses contact on the flick. Gets rapped on the pads, looks close and the umpire Jele raises his finger. Could the inward angle perhaps have taken it down leg? Sri Lanka do not have any reviews left. But it looks close, would have perhaps clipped leg and the umpire's call would have remained

dismissalComment.html: Sandakan breaks the flourishing opening stand in his second over. Tossed up - very full and wide outside off - turns away from de Kock. He drives loosely in the air, does not meet the pitch, and ends up chipping a catch to debutant Weerakkody, who can also keep wicket, at cover

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c & b Gunaratne 57 (71b 5x4 1x6 110m) SR: 80.28

dismissalComment.html: what a soft dismissal! The lack of pace does him in. This one in fact turns back in like an off-break. Besides, the lack of pace means that he plays early and does not time it well at all. Pops the simplest of return catches and the bowler takes it in front of him. Amla's fluent innings comes to an end but South Africa are coasting here
